docs.snippet: Using a helicopter and walkie-talkies. Federal agents moved on Gurney's Inn in Montaul, L.I., one of the largest hotel-restaurant complexes on Long Island, early yesterday, and arrested 17 employees as illegal aliens.
docs.lead_paragraph: Using a helicopter and walkie-talkies. Federal agents moved on Gurney's Inn in Montaul, L.I., one of the largest hotel-restaurant complexes on Long Island, early yesterday, and arrested 17 employees as illegal aliens.
docs.abstract: Immigration and Naturalization Service agents raid Gurney's Inn, Montauk, NJ, and arrest 17 employees as illegal aliens (S)

headline.main: 17 ON L.I. ARE HELD AS ILLEGAL ALIENS; Immigration Officers Raid Gurney's Inn at Montauk

docs.snippet: NEW HAVEN, May 31 Brazil captured the American Bicentennial Soccer Cup by defeating Italy, 4-1, in a bitterly fought game at Yale Bowl today before 36,096 fans, including Secretary of State Henry Kissinger.
docs.lead_paragraph: NEW HAVEN, May 31 Brazil captured the American Bicentennial Soccer Cup by defeating Italy, 4-1, in a bitterly fought game at Yale Bowl today before 36,096 fans, including Secretary of State Henry Kissinger.

headline.main: Brazilians Take Soccer Cup; Brazilians Take Soccer Cup

byline.original: By ALEX YANNIS Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, June 3 (AP) --The body of former President Juan Jose Torres of Bolivia has been found on a rural roadside, the authorities said today.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, June 3 (AP) --The body of former President Juan Jose Torres of Bolivia has been found on a rural roadside, the authorities said today.

headline.main: Torres, Ex-President of Bolivia, Found Murdered in Argentina; 'Man of the People' A Rapid Ascent

docs.snippet: Purpose The Organization of American States was founded in Bogota Colombia, in 1948, to foster mutual understanding and cooperation among the nations of the Western Hemisphere. Other aims were achievement of peace and justice, promotion of...
docs.lead_paragraph: Purpose The Organization of American States was founded in Bogota Colombia, in 1948, to foster mutual understanding and cooperation among the nations of the Western Hemisphere. Other aims were achievement of peace and justice, promotion of hemispheric solidarity and the defense of the sovereignty, territorial integrity and independence of member states.

docs.snippet: Chile's harsh military regime obviously hopes to gain a measure of international respectability by being host to the Sixth General Assembly of the Organization of American States, now under way in Santiago. Mexico is boycotting the sessions to...
docs.lead_paragraph: Chile's harsh military regime obviously hopes to gain a measure of international respectability by being host to the Sixth General Assembly of the Organization of American States, now under way in Santiago. Mexico is boycotting the sessions to protest Chile's violations of human rights, and other critics of the military rulers had urged Secretary of State Kissinger to do the same.
docs.abstract: ed supports Mex boycotting of OAS sessions to protest Chile's violation of human rights

docs.snippet: SANTIAGO, Chile, June 5 Foreign Minister Dudley Thompson of Jamaica told President Augasto Pinochet of Chile today that all American republics, including military dictatorships, should respect "a common international norm of human rights."
docs.lead_paragraph: SANTIAGO, Chile, June 5 Foreign Minister Dudley Thompson of Jamaica told President Augasto Pinochet of Chile today that all American republics, including military dictatorships, should respect "a common international norm of human rights."
docs.abstract: Jamaican Foreign Min Dudley Thompson tells Chilean Pres Augusto Pinochet that all Amer republics, including mil dictatorships, should respect 'common internatl norm of human rights,' luncheon meeting; problem of international reaction to human rights violations seen also to be developing in Uruguay, Brazil and Argentina, with evidence of deaths, torture and summary dismissal of persons from various insts; reaction of critics in US Cong has reduced econ and mil aid to Chile, and could be obstacle to Argentina's request for financial aid to meet foreign debts; mil leaders contend that they are faced with subversive movements, supported from abroad by trained guerrillas and money coming from Cuba and Soviet Bloc (M)

headline.main: O.A.S. Aide Cautions Chile On 'Norm of Human Rights'; 0.A.S. Aide Warns Chile on Human Rights 'Norm'

docs.snippet: SANTO DOMINGO, Dominican Republic, June 6 (AP) Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger opened his trip to Latin America today with an appeal for preservation of human rights, an issue expected to dominate the eightday journey.
docs.lead_paragraph: SANTO DOMINGO, Dominican Republic, June 6 (AP) Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger opened his trip to Latin America today with an appeal for preservation of human rights, an issue expected to dominate the eightday journey.
docs.abstract: US Sec Kissinger opens his trip to Latin Amer with appeal for preservation of human rights, luncheon given by Dominican Pres Joaquin Balaquer (S)

headline.main: Kissinger in Latin America, Makes Appeal on Rights

docs.snippet: ASUNCION, Paraguay, June 7 (UPI) A gunman shouting "Free Croatia!" shot Uruguay's Ambassador to Paraguay today, apparently mistaking him for the Yugoslav Ambassador, who was expected to be in the same area.
docs.lead_paragraph: ASUNCION, Paraguay, June 7 (UPI) A gunman shouting "Free Croatia!" shot Uruguay's Ambassador to Paraguay today, apparently mistaking him for the Yugoslav Ambassador, who was expected to be in the same area.
docs.abstract: Gunman shouting 'Free Croatia' shoots Carlos Abdala, Uruguay Amb to Paraguay in Asuncion, apparently mistaking him for Yugoslavia Amb Mancillo Vucekovic who was scheduled to make public appearance; gunman identified as Danziv Danjanovic

headline.main: Wrong Envoy Is Shot In Assassination Bid

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina (AP) All 25 political refugees from right-wing Latin American regimes who were abducted yesterday from two hotels were released today, United Nations officials said. Some had broken ribs and all had bruises.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina (AP) All 25 political refugees from right-wing Latin American regimes who were abducted yesterday from two hotels were released today, United Nations officials said. Some had broken ribs and all had bruises.
docs.abstract: 25 pol refugees who were abducted from 2 hotels in Buenos Aires, Argentina, are freed June 12; all said they had been tortured and given 48 hrs to leave country (M)

headline.main: ARGENTINES FREE 25 LATIN EXILES; Refugees Seized in Raid on Hotel Tell of Torture
